results.title: Bantu tribes of Southern Africa
results.creator_credit: Willem Vilioen and Paul Hoefler Special Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the old ways of life among the Zulu, Xhosa, Swazi, Ndebele, Sotho and Venda tribes. These various Bantu groups are now being brought into the South African industrial community. Outlines the ways in which this movement is changing the culture of the tribes and the struggle to preserve some of the old ways.

results.title: Balzac
results.creator_credit: Jean Vidal, AE Films and Les Films du Compas
results.brief_description: Contemporary paintings, manuscripts and lithographs are used in this film depicting the life of Balzac, nineteenth century French novelist. Beginning with shots of the workroom in which Balzac wrote many of his novels, the film flashes back to the Napoleonic era during which the writer was born. The film traces his boyhood, his career, the mounting of his debts, his love affairs, and concludes with his death which came after he had recreated a whole society in his ninety-six novels.

results.title: Ballet robotique
results.brief_description: This dynamic and playful work examines the use of robots in American industry. Exploiting the visual joys of the kinetic robotic motion set to a soundtrack by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra, this lightly humorous film show the industrial replacement of humans in tedious and hazardous tasks.

results.title: Ballet girl
results.brief_description: This film follows a small girl at the Royal Danish Ballet School. Follows her awakening interest in ballet, her entrance test, ballet classes and school lessons, her admiration of the older students and her progress to her first school ballet concert.
results.description: This film follows a small girl at the Royal Danish Ballet School. Follows her awakening interest in ballet, her entrance test, ballet classes and school lessons, her admiration of the older students and her progress to her first school ballet concert.

results.title: Ballet by Degas
results.creator_credit: J.H. Lenauer, George Jacobson and Mavis Lyons
results.brief_description: Studies of a number of the ballet paintings by Edgar Degas (1834-1917): “The Ballet Class”, “Coryphee Resting”, “Ballerina and the Lady with the Fan”, all from the Philadelphia Museum of Art, and “On Stage”, “Dancers Practising at the Bar”, and “Pink and Green” from the collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J.H. Lenauer, George Jacobson and Mavis Lyons

results.title: Balinese interlude
results.brief_description: A travelogue on Bali, one of the 7,000 islands that make up the land mass of Indonesia. We visit a fishing village, see examples and areas showing the ingenious terrace cultivation of rice. Many of the entertainments shown are based on Hindu-Balinese religious beliefs which also play a large part in the everyday life of villagers.

results.title: Bali: the island paradise
results.brief_description: An introduction to Bali emphasising village life, agriculture and culture with a focus on traditional dancing. Narrated by James A. FitzPatrick.

results.title: Silk and strings: a tale of Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Bay Street Pictures Inc and Seabourne Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”.
Presents traditional aspects of Taiwanese culture. Contrasts the simple life, costumes, and art and crafts of the original natives of Taiwan with the culture of the Chinese. Focuses on the traditions of China as they are retained in Taiwan, including the cultivation of the arts, music, and calligraphy.

results.title: Bali: island of temples
results.creator_credit: Deben Bhattacharya, John Seabourne and Bay Street Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”.
Shows how the every day lives of the Balinese is affected by the geography of the island and the Hindu attitude to the land.
